docs.lead_paragraph: Following is a fifth set of answers to readers' questions selected by Lucas A. Ferrara, a partner at Finkelstein Newman Ferrara who has practiced in the landlord-tenant arena for more than two decades.
docs.abstract: Taking Questions: A fifth installment of answers from Lucas A. Ferrara, a partner at Finkelstein Newman Ferrara who is taking questions from readers this week on tenant-landlord issues.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: A fifth installment of answers from Lucas A. Ferrara, a partner at Finkelstein Newman Ferrara who is taking questions from readers this week on tenant-landlord issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: A man who shot a young police officer had recently been sent to a state mental institution, to be confined until he was no longer a danger to himself or others.

headline.main: Officer’s Slaying Leaves New Orleans Asking Why
headline.print_headline: Officer’s Slaying Leaves New Orleans Asking Why

docs.lead_paragraph: Athletes attending college through 2012-13 will find fewer restrictions to determine reimbursement for educational expenses.

docs.lead_paragraph: In his new budget, President Bush will call for large cuts in the growth of Medicare and he will again seek major savings in Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: California regulators announced Tuesday that they are seeking as much as $1.33 billion in penalties from PacifiCare as a result of widespread problems stemming from its takeover two years ago by healthcare giant UnitedHealth Group.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Faces Fine Related to PacifiCare Merger

docs.abstract: California regulators announced Tuesday that they are seeking as much as $1.33 billion in penalties from PacifiCare as a result of widespread problems stemming from its takeover two years ago by healthcare giant UnitedHealth Group. In an investigation prompted by widespread complaints, the state Department of Insurance uncovered 133,000 alleged violations of state laws and [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton puckers up to kiss a Latina toddler against a soundtrack of salsa music in her latest Spanish-language TV ad, now showing in Super Tuesday states Arizona, California, Connecticut and New York.

headline.main: Clinton Aspires to be an Amiga

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's playful new television ad in Super Tuesday states paints her as a friend to Latinos.
